reviewText: This experience is a pretty short yet powerful experience. The graphics /audio are done really well and I love the use of a diorama as a story telling device in VR. Not sure I would necessarily justify the price compared to other VR games, but overall a very polished experience. Here is a video review I did of a small part of the experience: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UGSQ5pHcXSs
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I understand that this is just an interactive illustration, but there's just not much to it. You can't interact with some of the objects around you and others you can, but I can't tell what the point of any of that interaction is. It is fairly inexpensive, so there's not much risk in getting it but there's so many other compelling VR experiences out there now that this one doesn't bring anything new to the table.

reviewText: It's what you see in trailer and screenshots, you can see that single scene in VR from couple of camera angles and that's it. It's not fun, interesting or anything really. Hardly worth 1â‚¬, let alone 5.

reviewText: Yeah, it's simple but I love the atmosphere. Ghost cars are kinda cool.\n\nWhen I went thru the door one time I steped on the AC vent just as I stepped out into the rain! Extra immersive!
